H0.text: What term was popularized by Nobel Prize-winning Paul Crutzen to replace 'Holocene' epoch on the Geological Time Scale as he felt that the influence of humans on Earth is significant. Technocene

H1.text: What term was popularized by Nobel Prize-winning Paul Crutzen to replace 'Holocene' epoch on the Geological Time Scale as he felt that the influence of humans on Earth is significant. Homogenocene

H2.text: What term was popularized by Nobel Prize-winning Paul Crutzen to replace 'Holocene' epoch on the Geological Time Scale as he felt that the influence of humans on Earth is significant. Anthropogen

H3.text: What term was popularized by Nobel Prize-winning Paul Crutzen to replace 'Holocene' epoch on the Geological Time Scale as he felt that the influence of humans on Earth is significant. Anthrocene

A4.text: Paul J. Crutzen re-invented and popularized the term Anthropocene.

A5.text: The term Anthropocene is informally used in scientific contexts.

A6.text: Crutzen and Eugene F. Stoermer proposed using the term anthropocene for the current geological epoch.

A7.text: He popularized the term Anthropocene to describe a proposed new epoch in the Quaternary period when human actions have a drastic effect on the Earth.

A8.text: The term 'Anthropocene' (a term coined by Paul J. Crutzen and Eugene Stoermer in 2000) was never a formally defined geological unit.

A9.text: In May 2019, members of the working group voted in favour of recognizing the Anthropocene as formal chrono-stratigraphic unit, with stratigraphic signals around the mid-twentieth century CE as its base.

A10.text: The formal proposal was completed and submitted to the Subcommission on Quaternary Stratigraphy in late 2023 for a section in Crawford Lake, Ontario, with heightened Plutonium levels corresponding to 1952 CE.

A11.text: This proposal was rejected as a formal geologic epoch in early 2024, to be left instead as an 'invaluable descriptor of human impact on the Earth system'.

A12.text: Anthropogenic may also refer to things that have been generated by humans
